response.overview: Tomorrow is today - the drama of Brazilians impacted by climate change” shows that the impacts of climate have already reached all Brazilians, whether in the city, in the countryside or in the forest. Six Brazilians, from five states, tell how climate change has impacted their lives. The young indigenous woman who became a volunteer firefighter after an unprecedented forest fire; the small farmer who faced six years of drought; the centuries-old caiçara community forced to change territory due to the force of the sea; the merchant who saw his business destroyed by the rains and landslides that claimed hundreds of lives in Rio de Janeiro; the oyster producer penalized by rising sea temperatures; the woman who lost two cars, in a coastal city, to the storm surges that spread along the Brazilian coast.
response.title: O Amanhã é Hoje
